facts.text: I can breathe air! I have a special organ called a labyrinth that lets me gulp air from the surface.
I build bubble nests to protect my babies! I blow bubbles at the surface and stick my eggs inside them.
I'm called the Siamese fighting fish because males like me are very protective of our territory.
I come from rice paddies and canals in Thailand where the water has very little oxygen. That's why I learned to breathe air!
I love to eat mosquito babies! In the wild, I help control mosquito populations by eating their larvae.

profile.habitat: Rice paddies, floodplains, and canals in Southeast Asia
profile.diet: Mosquito larvae, zooplankton, and small insects
